basics.name: Yiting Chen
basics.label: Phd Student
basics.summary: A PhD student focusing on deeplearning

publications.name: Rethinking and improving robustness of convolutional neural networks: a shapley value-based approach in frequency domain
publications.authors: Yiting Chen, Qibing Ren, Junchi Yan
publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)
publications.summary: We investigate how deep neural networks(DNNs) utilize different frequency components and propose a method to improve the adversarial robustness of DNNs.

publications.name: Going Beyond Neural Network Feature Similarity: The Network Feature Complexity and Its Interpretation Using Category Theory
publications.authors: Yiting Chen, Zhanpeng Zhou, Junchi Yan
publications.summary: We define functional equivalent feature from a category theory perspective and further define and measure feature complexity of different deep neural networks.

publications.name: Unveiling The Matthew Effect Across Channels: Assessing Layer Width Sufficiency via Weight Norm Variance
publications.authors: Yiting Chen, Jiazi Bu, Junchi Yan
publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)
publications.summary: We show the Matthew effect exist between channels in deep neural networks and provide a new metric to assess layer width sufficiency.

publications.name: What Rotary Position Embedding Can Tell Us: Identifying Query and Key Weights Corresponding to Basic Syntactic or High-level Semantic Information
publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)
publications.summary: We show that for the widely used Rotary Position Embedding(RoPE), the angle of weight vector pairs for the query and key affects how the token position information is processed. We further propose a new method that could both reduce the fine-tuning parameter and boost the performance after fine-tuning.
